intro: Betonica stricta, commonly known as lesser betony, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features upright, branching stems covered in fine, hairy hairs. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly serrated edge. The flowers, which are blue to purple in color, appear in whorls along the stems and bloom from June to August.
